meanings.definition: A person, typically a woman, trained to assist women in childbirth.
meanings.sent1: The midwife helped the mother during the birth of her baby.
meanings.sent2: The midwife is an essential part of the birthing team.
meanings.sent3: The midwife joked that she had delivered so many babies, she could do it blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: She was like a guardian angel, the midwife guiding new life into the world.
meanings.sent5: The midwife's gentle touch and soothing words comforted the laboring mother.

meanings.definition: To assist in bringing forth or producing something.
meanings.sent1: She will midwife the project from conception to completion.
meanings.sent2: The team will midwife the development of the new product.
meanings.sent3: He midwifed the idea into a successful business venture.
meanings.sent4: Her guidance midwifed the growth of the organization.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's role is to midwife the talents of the mentee.
